important.label: Important notice
important.title: COVID-19 Prevention Measures

content_main.1: Face masks are mandatory when attending our clinic.
content_main.2: If you have a fever or chills or cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, runny nose or loss of sense of smell - please call our staff on 9842-8585 to organise a telephone consult with your doctor.
content_main.4: When you arrive, do not enter the clinic. Remain in your car and call to let us know you are here and we will call you in when it is your turn.

important.content_2: We are NOT one of the allocated clinics giving the vaccine. To find out where you can have yours, please click here and select ‘Book an appointment’. Enter your postcode and age group and a list of clinics will appear and you will be able to book for a Covid vaccine online.

content_1: Men's and Women's Health: family planning, Cervical screening/pap smears, pregnancy tests
content_3: Liquid nitrogen 'freezing' therapy for sunspots and warts
practice.content_4: Australian ClinicalLabs provides an on-site pathology service. Please call us to check their current operating hours

team.title: Meet the team
content: All our doctors are experienced in caring for patients of all ages and backgrounds and are highly dedicated to our patients.
We have multilingual staff and always strive to provide personalised, wholistic, high-quality family medical care for all of our patients.
Come visit us! We are committed to providing high quality medical care six days a week from our location on Blackburn Road.
team.link: <0>Appointments can be made from the link here</0>
lawrence_bio: Lawrence is a local Melbourne graduate and has been in General Practice locally for more than 30 years.
He has special interests in acupuncture, men's health, sports medicine and chronic disease management.
rose_bio: Rose graduated from University of Ceylon and has been in general practice locally and overseas for more than 30 years.
She has special interests in geriatrics, mental health & women's health.
sathi_bio: Sathi has over 18 years of Medical experience ranging from rural/remote medicine to acute trauma medicine, GP Anesthetists and Intensive care (ICU) management.
When not at work, Sathi enjoys family time as well as following emerging technologies in solar and battery systems to enable more sustainable lifestyle choices.

general.title: General
general.appointment_t: How can I make an appointment to see a doctor?
general.appointment_link: Consultations are by appointment only. Please ring the surgery on 03 9842 8585 to make an appointment or <0>book online via HotDoc</0>
appointment_c: Please tell the receptionist the following: your full name, address, date of birth and inform us how many people the consultation is for. We need to allocate a separate appointment time for each person.

If you need more time with the doctor, such as for an insurance medical (these are out of pocket-not claimable on Medicare), emotional difficulties or a second opinion, please tell the receptionist when you book your appointment as a longer consultation may be required. Please book a separate appointment for each person that needs to be seen.
Our doctors are committed to being on time. However, emergencies will be seen before booked appointments.
general.privacy_t: What are DEFMC’s privacy laws and policy on medical information management?
privacy_c: It is our strict policy to maintain the absolute security for all our medical records. We respect that they are conﬁdential documents and none of the information will be accessed by any unauthorised personnel.
We will only release your medical records upon provision of a signed authority from yourself when you decide to seek medical care elsewhere or if you are moving to a different area.
general.reminder_t: What is the Recall & Reminder System?
reminder_c: Our practice is committed to providing optimal care and as such, subscribes to all government recall systems for Cervical screening/Pap smears and Immunisations.
All patients needing follow up treatment are automatically placed onto these recall systems.  Please let your doctor know if you do not wish to participate.
Please respond to all recalls either via phone or letter.
general.prescription_t: How can I receive my electronic prescription (eScript) information?
prescription_c: You can now receive your prescription electronically; this is called an eScript.

Your doctor can SMS or email you a link which has a QR code. Take this code to any pharmacy of your choice. If there are Repeats on the prescription, the pharmacy will issue you with a new QR code. Please note that eScripts are only available for patients with an IHI number.

This new service avoids the need for patients to collect a paper prescription for their medications. You must have a smart phone or an email address to receive an eScript. If needed, you can forward the SMS or email to another person, and they can collect the medication on your behalf.
general.repeat_t: How do I make repeat prescriptions/referrals?
repeat_c: Requests for repeat prescriptions, referral letters and medical certificates will not be taken over the phone. You must make an appointment with your doctor to obtain these.

Referral letters are usually valid for 12 months from any general practitioners and 3 months only from any other specialists. They will generally require to be renewed before seeing your specialist - please note that they are legally not allowed to be backdated.
general.disabled_t: Is there disabled access to the building?
general.disabled_c: We provide disabled parking at the back entrance, a wheelchair accessible toilet on premises and front and rear automatic sliding doors

appointments.title: Appointments
appointments.group_t: Can I organise a longer consultation or an appointment for my family to be seen together?
appointments.group_c: Please indicate when you ring for an appointment if a longer consultation is expected for complex or multiple problems. Double appointments are recommended for each individual members of your family to be seen together; if more than one family member is anticipated to be seen by the doctor, please book an appointment time for each member.
appointments.schedule_t: Why was I not seen at my scheduled time?
appointments.schedule_c: Our doctors are equally committed to being on time and the maintenance of the high quanity of care, so it is possible that you might not be seen at your scheduled time due to longer than normal time spent on some patients with complicated issues and unexpected emergencies.
appointments.walkin_c: Walk-ins are catered for as long as we are able to ﬁt you in, but appointments are strongly recommended. Patients with appointments are generally prioritised to be seen before those without an appointment. Please let us know as soon as possible if you are unable to make your appointment - adequate notice for cancellations is much appreciated, both by us and by the other patients.
appointments.results_t: Do I need to make an appointment to discuss test results?
appointments.results_c: An appointment is required to discuss all test results with your doctor. No results will be given over the phone due to privacy laws. Please note that our reception staff are not clinically trained and as such, aren’t legally permitted to discuss results.
appointments.phone_t: Can I speak to a doctor over the phone instead of making an appointment?
phone_c: Please explain what you need to the reception staff and a detailed message will be taken. If the doctor deems the call as clinically significant, they will call you back at the soonest possible time.
We ask that patients please do not misuse this service and let the receptionist deal with non-clinical queries.

billing.title: Fees & Billing
bulk_c: Normal fees apply for all consultations. The first visit will be billed at the normal private rate regardless of age and concession card status.
After the first visit, Pensioners, Health Care Card holders and children under 16 will be bulk billed Monday to Friday.
There is no bulk billing on a Saturday and will incur a higher fee regardless of concession status.
Please note higher fees also apply for longer consultation. Additionally, a consultation fee applies for all new patients or existing patients who have not attended in the last 3 years
Accounts need to be settled at the time of consultation.  An administration fee of $10 will apply for accounts not settled at this time. Please ask reception if you have any queries
billing.payment_t: What payment methods does DEFMC accept?
billing.payment_c: We accept cash, cheque and payment by EFTPOS and credit cards. We can claim the Medicare Rebate on your behalf if you have your correct bank details registered with Medicare
billing.rebate_t: How do I receive my Medicare rebate?
billing.rebate_c: Consultation fees attract a Medicare rebate if eligible and you can have your rebate deposited into your account if you have registered your bank account details with Medicare or if you can provide us with your BSB and Account numbers.
billing.fee_t: Why did I incur a $10 administration fee after my consultation?
billing.fee_c: Accounts need to be settled at the time of consultation, otherwise an administration fee of $10 will apply to accounts not settled on the day of consultation.

emergency.title: Emergency appointments
emergency.description: DEFMC have limited spaces during the day for Emergency appointments. Please respect that the purpose of an emergency appointment is to deal with the immediate problem and is not suitable for managing your routine health and medical issues.
emergency.000a: In cases of extreme medical emergency, like chest pain or suspicion of stroke, call “000” immediately. Otherwise, call the surgery and you will be instructed as to the best course of action to take.
emergency.000b: Please advise our staff if your call is a medical emergency so that you are not put on hold.
emergency.gp: After Hours GPs Clinic (open until 11.30pm nightly)

afterhours.title: After hours
description: When the surgery is closed, if you are calling regarding a medical emergency, please hang up & call “000” for an ambulance immediately
The closest Emergency Dept is at Box Hill Hospital. Entry via Rodgerson Road
If you would like a home visiting doctor, please call 13 74 25. They are available weeknights, weekends, and public holidays

parking: Limited parking available on site. Alternatively, 2 hour parking is available around the corner on Beverley Street

feedback.title: Patient feedback
feedback.description: Patient feedback is encouraged and should be directed to the Practice Manager. We take your concerns, complaints and comments seriously and appreciate your suggestions.  If you feel your issue needs to be addressed outside the practice please contact:

privacy.title: Privacy Laws – Medical Records
privacy.content_1: Your medical record is a confidential document. No medical information will we accessed by unauthorised personnel. It is the policy of this practice to maintain security of medical records.
privacy.content_2: Please refrain from sending sensitive personal information to us via email unless the message is encrypted with a password which is sent in a separate email.
